observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:white male aged 28 ys presents via EMS a short time following MVA. he was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head. Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 20 mph on impact. pt c/o mild blurred vision, moderate neck pain, mild dizziness and Traumatic Injury - Blunt.No loss of consciousness o:Height 192 cm, Weight 105.7 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 88, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, NAD, Neck = supple w/o TTP, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL w/ no deficits, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Psych = Mood, affect NL, appropriate judgement a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:white male aged 28 ys presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion. he denies blurred vision, dizziness and neck pain. Furthermore, he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 190 cm, Weight 101.2 kg, Temperature 36.6 C, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=95,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=42.1,Reaction Time=0.51, HEENT = NCAT, PERRL, C/V = RRR, Abd = Soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Neck = Supple, Pulm = CTAB. Good respiratory effort, MS = Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with no loss of consciousness). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Neck = Supple , Pulm = CTAB
